name: Ramada Hialeah-Miami Airport

reviews.text: Do not book a room here because no one on staff seems to care. I needed a hotel close to the airport and one with an airport shuttle. The hotel's shuttle service was awful, and I was picked up 80 minutes after I first called the hotel; I saw each hotel's vans go by two and three times with drivers hoping out to get their guests bags. When the Ramada van arrived the driver just opened the door, making no attempts to move. When I got to the hotel I could hardly hear because of the loud bass thumping from the hotel's lounge. I asked if my package had arrived, and the desk clerk said it had not. I had to go to my room, access the UPS website to prove the package had, indeed, been "delivered" that morning, and I had to go into their back room and find the box myself! The TV remote control did not work. The reviews I had read before booking said the A/C units didn't work, but I didn't think that mattered since it was Nov. 30 and you don't need the A/C. But I was wrong because there's no heat either! The carpet had visible stains. This over-priced hotel does not provide a complimentary breakfast. Although they have an on-site restaurant, there was only two wait staff and one busser for this large hotel that was sold out because one of the airlines had given out vouchers. Even though I was a party of one, the gratuity was included in the cost! The checkout line was so long I thought I might miss the 9:00 a.m. shuttle. I told the driver I needed to be dropped off at the rental car facility. I was dropped off so far away from the facility it took me 30 minutes to use the walkways that took me to the tram that goes to the rentals. I caught a cold three days later, and I'm sure I got infected at the Ramada.
reviews.title: Don't book a room here

reviews.text: The convenience of transportation to and from the airport is something I could handle.The room service could have been better,they need to pay attention to the air-condition units (the one in my room kept loud noises all during the night).
reviews.title: Not for Long stay.Just for shopping !

reviews.text: The one thing that this hotel has going for it is location, location, location. 49th Street is a shopper's paradise. One can walk to the mall, and several department stores that are on this street.
reviews.title: Location

reviews.text: The front desk staff were quite helpful, although it took a long while to check us in. The hotel was quite busy while we were there, a junior sporting team was there, so it was a bit noisy in the common areas. An airport shuttle is available and is very swift and prompt from the long distance from Hialeah to the airport.
reviews.title: Excellent Service from Shuttle to Restaurant

reviews.text: Stopped here for 3 days before heading up to NY. Our room was small but clean. Beds were small, hard and uncomfortable.Other than that there isn't much else to be said about the room, it was just a room. I am 5' 11" ( a bit tall) but the room felt like it was made for an adolescent. Tony the front desk agent was pleasant and was a wonderful help. The pool was closed for renovations during my stay. Stay away from the lounge and restaurant- Complete rip off with their pricing! Nice location. IHOP, Mall, Red Lobster, bank and many others in walking distance. I recommend this place for a pit stop but if your planning to stay more than 3 days and without a vehicle... Just don't do it!
reviews.title: Three Days

reviews.text: It was just one stop for 2 days before our cruise trip. At the arrival, the first surprise was to find a so friendly staff. The manager Mr. Tony was so profesional and courteous.
reviews.title: Just a stop

reviews.text: Room nice and clean, restaurant and shopping all over the area, we will be there again next trip. Thanks ALL for a very good stay. Steve. NYC
reviews.title: I would not stay here ever again.

reviews.text: Free hourly shuttle service to and from airport. Shopping and restaurants within walking distance.
reviews.title: Maintenance problem

reviews.text: Very roomy with adequate seating and work space.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: Hotel seems a bit dated and worn. Could use with a renovation, including new carpet and paint.
reviews.title: 5 day stay
Not sure anything can be done to improve this property
reviews.text: The plusses are free airport shuttle (available from 6am-11pm), free internet, the mall and a red lobster 5 minutes walk away. The staff seem uninterested in their guests, can barely look up from the desk when you go up to ask a question. I asked if I had to book the airport shuttle and was told to take the clipboard at the end of the desk and write my room number and number of passengers down..I think this is something the staff should do. I went to the concierge desk to ask for directions....the two gentlemen there were busy looking at their ipad or tablet and laughing...I had to wait. Calling front desk at 9pm for a wake up call, I cradled the phone over my shoulder for approximately 5 minutes before I got a reply. The bedroom is dated, the popcorn ceilings though painted are decaying...the corridors are just old..on the website it says recently renovated in 2011...don't see how this could be. Aside from gutting it, not sure if the rooms can be brought up to scratch. At 5.30am the lobby was full as the hotel seems to be used for cruise ship crew lodging and they were all waiting for departure. I watched as each one went to the reception to ask for something and the lady hardly raised her head up from the computer...why? they are guests too are they not? mind you I wasn't treated any better.

Didn't like the place. Mildew on tiles, soap residue on shower soapdish, wifi didn't work (too slow, had to use my mobile data). >20 min from airport. They left pool main lights on all night, brightness entered the room. Room had a balcony but without any doors to get in. Outdated and worn gym equipment.
reviews.title: Needs major renovation.

reviews.text: The hotel is really nothing special. Average in every respect. What attracted us was the airport pick up and cruise drop off shuttle. They did a good job of the pick up and drop off.
reviews.title: Good For One Night - Stay & Cruise

aka: Ramada Inn Miami Airport North Hotel Hialeah
description: Located in the heart of South Florida's Shopper's Paradise, the Ramada Miami Airport North is within walking distance of many retail stores and restaurants.We are approximately 10 miles from the Miami International airport, away from the typical congestion and noise of an airport hotel. Free airport pickup and delivery is available from 6 am to 9 pm daily.Few Miami airport hotels offer a better location than the Ramada Airport North.
